decomposed.wish: enable secure user authentication and session management that validates credentials against identity providers, creates session tokens with configurable expiry, and protects accounts through failed attempt tracking and account locking. this capability is foundational for all authenticated operations in the platform.

provide reliable data persistence with automatic cache invalidation that writes entities to primary datastore, invalidates relevant cache entries, propagates changes to replicas, and emits domain events for subscribers. this capability ensures data consistency across the platform.

deliver real-time notifications to clients via websockets with delivery tracking, retry mechanisms, and queue management for disconnected clients. this capability depends on domain events from the persistence layer to trigger notifications when relevant events occur.

provide analytics and custom reporting capabilities that aggregate data from event store, apply configured filters, render visualizations, and cache results for repeated access. this capability enables administrators to gain insights from platform data stored in the persistence layer.

enforce tenant boundaries and isolation that applies tenant-specific configuration, prevents cross-tenant data access, logs with tenant context, and raises security events on unauthorized access attempts. this capability is essential for enterprise-scale deployments requiring data segregation.

manage api rate limits and quota tracking that returns appropriate 429 responses when limits are exceeded, tracks rate limit state per client, decrements available quota on consumption, and notifies on threshold breaches. this capability protects platform resources from overuse and ensures fair access.
